org.dmd.util
Class BooleanVar

java.lang.Object
  org.dmd.util.BooleanVar

public class BooleanVar
extends java.lang.Object

The BooleanVar class provides for the storage of a boolean value that can be changed. This allows for a reference to a boolean to be passed and alterred. It also allows for the alteration of a boolean value object without having to create a new Boolean.

equals

public static boolean equals(boolean testVal,
                             java.lang.Object obj)
Checks if the object is a BooleanVar that equals the test value and returns true if so. If the object is null and the test value if false, we return true i.e. the non-existence of the flag object equates to false.

If the object is not a BooleanVar, we return false.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Checks if the object is a BooleanVar that equals the test value and returns true if so. If the object is null or not a BooleanVar, we return false.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
